entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

Create a new post

More info: Writing

Run server

More info: Server

Generate static files

More info: Generating

Deploy to remote sites

More info: Deployment
entry.summary: This is the hello world of Hexo

entry.title: CURRICULUM VITAE
entry.content:
Guo Siyuan


Department of Biology, Southern University of Science and Technology
1088 Xueyuan Avenue, Shenzhen 518055, P.R. China
Email: 11611118@mail.sustech.edu.cn
GitHub: https://github.com/c235gsy
Phone: +86 177-7386-6219

Education

Sept. 2016 – Present
Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech)
Bachelor of Science in Bioinformatics Expected in Jun. 2020
GPA : 3.75/4.00         (All courses required for graduation have been finished)
Major Rank : Top 2/6
Supervisor : Prof. Wenfei Jin

Expertise and Technical Strengths

Programming : Python, R, Matlab, Java, LATEX, Markdown
Software : Linux, Git, FastQC, Bowtie 2, Zotero,Keynote, PPT, Pr, Final Cut Pro, Anaconda, Scikit-learn, Numpy, Scipy, Pandas, Matplotib, Hexo
Expertise : Mathematical Modeling, Data Structures, Algorithms, Artificial Intelligence, Probability Theory, Mathematical Statistics, Ordinary Differential Equations, Calculus, Linear Algebra, Biochemistry, Genetics, Molecular Biology
Experiment : Cell Culture, Cell Transfection, Western Blot, PCR, qPCR, Paraffin Method, HE Stain, Von Cossa Stain, Mouse Breeding, Mouse Anatomy
Language : Mandarin Chinese (Native), English

Research Experience

Developed a Single-cell Trajectory Inference Method Based on Principle Curve with Single-cell RNA-seq Data
Nov. 2018 – Present @ SUSTech, Shenzhen, P.R.China
Research Leader, Advisor: Prof. Wenfei Jin

  • Got cell developmental paths form the last research project
  • Calculated the connection of each cluster center to get the general trend of the single-cell trajectories
  • Filtered cell signals that heavily deviate from the general trend of the single-cell trajectories
  • Obtained the cell lineages with single-cell accuracy by designing a new method to fit the principle curves of different cell developmental trajectories with the filtered data
  • Merged the common parts of different cell trajectories
  • Projected cells onto trajectories and got the location of cells in the developmental trajectories
  • Analyzed the gene expression and locations in cell trajectory of cells in every trajectory to got the key genes control the cell differentiation in this developmental path

Developed a Method Based on Bayesian Formula to Predict Developmental Relation- ships Between Cell Clusters with Single-cell RNA-seq Data
Mar. 2018 – Nov. 2018 @ SUSTech, Shenzhen, P.R.China
Research Leader, Advisor: Prof. Wenfei Jin

  • Performed single-cell RNA-seq on bone marrow samples from leukemia patients
  • Converted sequencing data into gene expression data by softwares
  • Evaluate similarity between cell clusters with multiple statistic
  • Designed a new method based on the Bayesian formula to combine different statistics into one single statistic to infer the similarity matrix between different cell clusters
  • Inferred the developmental paths with the similarity matrix
  • Projected cells from a new sample onto the reference dataset to trace cell origins with the new method
  • Compared datasets of similar biological origin collected by different labs with the new method to ensure that the annotation and the analysis is consistent

Investigated The Function of Kindlin-2 in Chondrocytes, Osteoblast and Osteoclast Via Animal Model (floxp-cre mouse)
Sept. 2017 – Mar. 2018 @ SUSTech, Shenzhen, P.R.China
Researcher, Advisor: Prof. Guozhi Xiao

  • Established none kindlin-2 mice via floxp-cre
  • Observed the bone development and cartilage development of different floxp-cre mice and compared them with wild-type mice
  • Anatomized the mice and peel off the bones
  • Made paraffin slices with bones and explored the development and molecular characteristics of mice bones with paraffin slices via different dyeing techniques
  • Isolated chondrocytes, osteoblast and osteoclast form specific floxp-cre mice
  • Explored the proliferation and metabolism changes of none kindlin-2 chondrocytes, osteoblast and osteoclast via western blot, qPCR, staining techniques and flow cytometry

Awards and Honors

2018
Excellent Individual In Winter Vacation Social Practice Activities, SUSTech.
2017–2018
Merit Student Scholarship for Exceptional Performance, SUSTech.
2016–2018
Outstanding Student Leader, SUSTech.
2017
Excellent Individual In Winter Vacation Social Practice Activities, SUSTech.
2016–2017
Merit Student Scholarship for Exceptional Performance, SUSTech.
